Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 30(1)a of the Food and Drugs Act, hereby makes the annexed Natural Health Products Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Food and Drugs Act. (Loi)

adverse reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a natural health product that occurs at any dose used or tested for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of a disease or for modifying an organic function. (réaction indésirable)
brand name means a name in English or French, whether or not it includes the name of a manufacturer, corporation, partnership or individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is used to distinguish the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under which a natural health product is sold or advertised. (marque nominative)

Definition.Text: case report means a detailed record of all relevant data associated with the use of a natural health product in a subject. (fiche d’observation)
Compendium means the Compendium of Monographs published by the Department of Health and as amended from time to time. (Compendium)
distributor means a person who sells a natural health product to another person for the purpose of further sale by that other person. (distributeur)
expiry date means the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date, expressed at minimum as a year and month, that is the end of the stability period determined under section 52; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date, expressed at minimum as a year and month, after which the manufacturer recommends that the natural health product should not be used. (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: immediate container means the container that is in direct contact with a natural health product. (contenant immédiat)
importer means a person who imports a natural health product into Canada for the purpose of sale. (importateur)
inner label means the label on or affixed to an immediate container of a natural health product. (étiquette intérieure)
List A means the document entitled List of Certain Natural Health Products for Distribution as Samples, dated March 2020 and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Liste A)
lot number means any combination of letters, figures, or both, by which a natural health product can be traced in manufacture and identified in distribution. (numéro de lot)

manufacturer means a person who fabricates or processes a natural health product for the purpose of sale, but does not include a pharmacist or other health care practitioner who, at the request of a patient, compounds a natural health product for the purpose of sale to that patient. (fabricant)

natural health product means a substance set out in Schedule 1 or a combination of substances in which all the medicinal ingredients are substances set out in Schedule 1, a homeopathic medicine or a traditional medicine, that is manufactured, sold or represented for use in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state or its symptoms in humans;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: restoring or correcting organic functions in humans; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: modifying organic functions in humans, such as modifying those functions in a manner that maintains or promotes health.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: However, a natural health product does not include a substance set out in Schedule 2, any combination of substances that includes a substance set out in Schedule 2 or a homeopathic medicine or a traditional medicine that is or includes a substance set out in Schedule 2. (produit de santé naturel)

Definition.Text: outer label means the label on or affixed to the outside of a package of a natural health product. (étiquette extérieure)
principal display panel has the same meaning as in the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations. (espace principal)
probiotic means a monoculture or mixed-culture of live micro-organisms that benefit the microbiota indigenous to humans. (probiotique)
proper name means, in respect of an ingredient of a natural health product, one of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the ingredient is a vitamin, the name for that vitamin set out in item 3 of Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the ingredient is a plant or a plant material, an alga, a bacterium, a fungus, a non-human animal material or a probiotic, the Latin nomenclature of its genus and, if any, its specific epithet; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the ingredient is other than one described in paragraphs (a) or (b), the chemical name of the ingredient. (nom propre)

Definition.Text: recommended conditions of use means, in respect of a natural health product,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended use or purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its dosage form;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended dose;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its risk information, including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with its use. (conditions d’utilisation recommandées)

Definition.Text: security package means a package having a security feature that provides reasonable assurance to consumers that the package has not been opened prior to purchase. (emballage de sécurité)

serious adverse reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a natural health product that occurs at any dose and that requires in-patient hospitalization or a prolongation of existing hospitalization, that causes congenital malformation, that results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, that is life threatening or that results in death. (réaction indésirable grave)

serious unexpected adverse reaction means a serious adverse reaction that is not identified in nature, severity or frequency in the risk information set out on the label of the natural health product. (réaction indésirable grave et imprévue)
specifications means a description of a natural health product that contains the information described in subsection 44(2). (spécifications)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the words and expressions used in the provisions of the Food and Drug Regulations that are incorporated by reference by these Regulations shall have the meanings assigned to them by these Regulations, but if no meanings are assigned, they shall have any meaning assigned to them by the Food and Drug Regulations.

The word manufacturer in the provisions of the Food and Drug Regulations that are incorporated by reference by these Regulations shall have the meaning assigned to it by the Food and Drug Regulations.
These Regulations apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of natural health products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacture, packaging, labelling and importation for sale of natural health products;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the distribution of natural health products; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the storage of natural health products for the purposes of any of the activities referred to in paragraphs (b) and (c).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a substance or combination of substances or a traditional medicine is not considered to be a natural health product if its sale, under the Food and Drug Regulations, is required to be pursuant to a prescription when it is sold other than in accordance with section C.01.043 of those Regulations.

Section.Text: Except where otherwise indicated in these Regulations, the provisions of the Food and Drug Regulations do not apply to natural health products.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall sell a natural health product unless a product licence is issued in respect of the natural health product.

No product licence holder, manufacturer, importer or distributor of a natural health product for which a product licence is issued shall sell the natural health product during any period that the sale of that natural health product is directed to be stopped under section 17.
No person shall sell a natural health product for which a product licence is issued

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of any suspension of the licence under section 18 or 19; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after cancellation of the licence under paragraph 20(b).

Section.Text: An application for a product licence shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number, and if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the address submitted under paragraph (a) is not a Canadian address, the name, address and telephone number, and if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the applicant’s representative in Canada to whom notices may be sent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each medicinal ingredient of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its proper name and its common name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity per dosage unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its potency, if a representation relating to its potency is to be shown on any label of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of its source material, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement indicating whether it is synthetically manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a qualitative list of the non-medicinal ingredients that are proposed for the natural health product and for each ingredient listed, a statement that indicates the purpose of the ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: each brand name under which the natural health product is proposed to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended conditions of use for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: information that demonstrates the safety and efficacy of the natural health product when it is used in accordance with the recommended conditions of use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the text of each label that is proposed to be used in conjunction with the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the specifications to which the natural health product will comply; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: one of the following attestations, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the natural health product is imported, an attestation by the applicant that the natural health product will be manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 or in accordance with requirements that are equivalent to those set out in Part 3, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the natural health product is not imported, an attestation by the applicant that the natural health product will be manufactured, packaged, labelled, distributed and stored in accordance with requirements set out in Part 3.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall dispose of an application submitted under section 5 within 60 days after the day on which it is submitted if, in support of the application, the only information submitted by the applicant under paragraph 5(g) is that which is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application respecting a natural health product that has only one medicinal ingredient, contained in a monograph for that medicinal ingredient in the Compendium; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application respecting a natural health product that has more than one medicinal ingredient, contained in a monograph for that combination of medicinal ingredients in the Compendium.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister requests that additional information or samples be submitted under section 15, the 60-day period referred to in subsection (1) does not include the number of days beginning on the day on which the request is made and ending on the day on which the additional information or samples are received.
For the purposes of this section, the Minister disposes of an application on the earlier of the day on which

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence is issued in accordance with section 7; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is sent a notice under subsection 9(1).

Section.Text: The Minister shall issue or amend a product licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant submits an application to the Minister that is in accordance with section 5 or subsection 11(2), as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant submits to the Minister all additional information or samples requested under section 15;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not make a false or misleading statement in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance or amendment of the licence, as the case may be, is not likely to result in injury to the health of a purchaser or consumer.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall assign a product number to each natural health product in respect of which a product licence is issued.

In the case of a natural health product that is a drug for which a drug identification number is assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, the product number assigned under subsection (1) shall be the drug identification number.
If the Minister refuses to issue or amend a product licence, the Minister shall send the applicant a notice that sets out the reason for the refusal.
Within 30 days after the day on which the notice is sent, the applicant may make a request that the Minister reconsider the application.
If the applicant makes a request in accordance with subsection (2), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give the applicant an opportunity to be heard in respect of the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reconsider the application after giving the applicant that opportunity.

Subsection.Text: After reconsidering the application, the Minister shall issue or amend the product licence if the requirements of section 7 are met.
If the Minister again refuses to issue or amend the product licence, the Minister shall send the applicant a final notice that sets out the reason for the refusal.

If the licensee makes any of the following changes in respect of the natural health product, the licensee shall not sell any lot or batch of the natural health product affected by the change unless the product licence is amended accordingly:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to its recommended dose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to its recommended duration of use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the deletion or modification of risk information shown on any of its labels, including the deletion or modification of a caution, warning, contra-indication or known adverse reaction associated with its use;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a change of its recommended use or purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a change of the source material of any of its medicinal ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: changing any of its medicinal ingredients to or from being synthetically manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the potency of any of its medicinal ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting its safety or efficacy that does not arise as a result of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a change to the quantity of a medicinal ingredient per dosage unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the addition or substitution of a medicinal ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a change to its dosage form, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a change to its recommended route of administration; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: one or more of the following changes to its specifications, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the removal of a test method set out in the specifications,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the modification of a test method set out in the specifications in a manner that widens the purity tolerances of the natural health product or the quantity, identity or potency tolerances of any of its medicinal ingredients, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the modification of a test method set out in the specifications in a manner that renders it less precise, accurate, specific or sensitive.

Subsection.Text: An application to amend a product licence shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product number of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement identifying each change described in subsection (1) that has been made;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information demonstrating that the natural health product is safe and efficacious after the change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the text of each label to be used in conjunction with the natural health product after the change, if the change is any of those described in paragraphs (1)(a) to (h); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the revised specifications, if the change is any of those described in paragraph (1)(g) or (i).

Subsection.Text: If the licensee makes any of the changes described in subsection (2) in respect of the natural health product, the licensee shall, within 60 days after the day on which the change is made,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister of the change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with the text of each label used in conjunction with the natural health product since the change, if the change is any of those described in paragraphs (2)(d) to (f).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), changes in respect of a natural health product are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to any of the information submitted under paragraph 5(a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to any of the information provided under section 22;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition or substitution of a non-medicinal ingredient, the addition or substitution of which does not affect its safety or efficacy;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its sale under a brand name other than one submitted under paragraph 5(e);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a change of the common or proper name of any of its medicinal ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of risk information to any of its labels, including the addition of a caution, warning, contra-indication or known adverse reaction associated with its use.

Section.Text: For greater certainty, if the licensee makes any of the following fundamental changes in respect of the natural health product, the licensee may not sell the natural health product affected by the change unless a product licence is issued in accordance with section 7 for the natural health product as changed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the quantity of a medicinal ingredient per dosage unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition or substitution of a medicinal ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a change to its dosage form; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a change to its recommended route of administration.

Subsection.Text: A product licence shall set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product number of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the dosage form that is authorized for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended route of administration that is authorized for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended dose that is authorized for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended duration of use, if any, that is authorized for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each medicinal ingredient of the natural health product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its authorized quantity per dosage unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its authorized potency, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its authorized source material;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended use or purpose that is authorized for the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the licence was issued.

Subsection.Text: Within 60 days after the day on which the product licence is issued, the licensee shall notify the Minister of any information set out on the licence that the licensee knows to be incorrect.

Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of a product licence application under section 5 or an application for amendment under subsection 11(2) are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the product licence should be issued or amended, as the case may be, the Minister may request that the applicant provide such additional information or samples of the natural health product as are necessary to make the determination.

If the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that a natural health product may no longer be safe when used under the recommended conditions of use, the Minister may request that the licensee provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day on which the request is received, with information and documents demonstrating that the natural health product is safe when used under the recommended conditions of use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may direct the licensee, manufacturer, importer and distributor to stop their sale of a natural health product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee does not, within the required period, provide the Minister with the information and documents requested under section 16;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information and documents provided by the licensee in accordance with section 16 do not demonstrate that the natural health product is safe when used under the recommended conditions of use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a natural health product that is imported, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the natural health product is not manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed or stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 or in accordance with requirements that are equivalent to those set out in Part 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a natural health product that is not imported, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the natural health product is not manufactured, packaged, labelled, distributed or stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the natural health product is not packaged or labelled in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 5.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall lift a direction to stop the sale of a natural health product if the licensee provides the Minister with information and documents demonstrating that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a direction to stop sale arising under either paragraph (1)(a) or (b), the natural health product is safe when used under the recommended conditions of use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a direction to stop sale arising under paragraph (1)(c), the natural health product is manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 or in accordance with requirements that are equivalent to those set out in Part 3;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a direction to stop sale arising under paragraph (1)(d), the natural health product is manufactured, packaged, labelled, distributed and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a direction to stop sale arising under paragraph (1)(e), the natural health product is packaged and labelled in accordance with the requirements of Part 5; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the direction to stop the sale of the natural health product did not exist.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister may suspend a product licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has contravened these Regulations or any provision of the Act relating to the natural health product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has made a false or misleading statement in the application submitted under section 5 or the application for amendment under subsection 11(2).

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 19, the Minister shall not suspend a product licence unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sent the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for the intended suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has not, within 90 days after the day on which the notice referred to in paragraph (a) is received, provided the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the licence should not be suspended on the grounds that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension did not exist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension has been corrected.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a product licence before giving the licensee an opportunity to be heard if, as a result of any circumstance, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a purchaser or consumer.

If the Minister suspends a product licence under section 18 or 19, the Minister shall send the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for the suspension and the day on which the suspension is effective, and the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the licence if, within 90 days after the day on which the suspension is effective, the licensee provides the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the situation giving rise to the suspension did not exist or that it has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the licence if, within 90 days after the day on which the suspension is effective, the licensee has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: If the Minister cancels a licence under paragraph 20(b), the Minister shall send the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for the cancellation and the day on which the cancellation is effective.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the licensee shall provide the Minister with the following information prior to commencing the sale of the natural health product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each manufacturer, packager, labeller and importer of the natural health product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s name, address and telephone number, and if applicable, the person’s facsimile number and electronic mail address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the person conducts the activity in Canada, the number assigned to the site licence issued in respect of that activity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number, and if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of each distributor of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of each building in which the natural health product is manufactured, packaged or labelled;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of each building in which the natural health product is stored for the purposes of importation or distribution; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the natural health product is imported, evidence establishing that the natural health product will be manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 or in accordance with requirements that are equivalent to those set out in Part 3.

Subsection.Text: If the natural health product is one in respect of which a drug identification number is assigned in accordance with subsection C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations and at the time the product licence is issued in respect of the natural health product it is already being sold, the licensee shall provide the information referred to in subsection (1) within 30 days after the day on which the product licence is issued.
Every licensee who sells a natural health product shall maintain the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all ingredients contained in each lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale.

Subsection.Text: The records shall be maintained by the licensee for a period of one year following the expiry date of the natural health product to which that record relates.
A licensee shall provide the Minister with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a case report for each serious adverse reaction to the natural health product that occurs inside Canada, within 15 days after the day on which the licensee becomes aware of the reaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a case report for each serious unexpected adverse reaction to the natural health product that occurs inside or outside Canada, within 15 days after the day on which the licensee becomes aware of the reaction.

Subsection.Text: A licensee who sells a natural health product shall annually prepare and maintain a summary report that contains a concise and critical analysis of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all adverse reactions to the natural health product that have occurred inside Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all reactions for which a case report is required to be provided under subsection (1), that have occurred

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the previous 12 months, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: at a dose used or tested for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of a disease or for modifying organic functions in humans.

Subsection.Text: If after reviewing a case report provided under subsection (1) or after reviewing any other safety data relating to the natural health product, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the natural health product may no longer be safe when used under the recommended conditions of use, the Minister may request that, within 30 days after the day on which the request is received, the licensee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide to the Minister a copy of any summary report prepared under subsection (2); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepare and provide to the Minister an interim summary report containing a concise and critical analysis of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all adverse reactions to the natural health product that have occurred inside Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all reactions for which a case report is required to be provided under subsection (1), that have occurred

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: since the date of the most recent summary report prepared under subsection (2), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at a dose used or tested for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of a disease or for modifying organic functions in humans.

Section.Text: Every licensee who commences a recall of a natural health product shall provide the Minister with the information referred to in section 62 within three days after the day on which the recall is commenced.
This Part does not apply to any activity that is conducted in respect of a natural health product solely for the purposes of a clinical trial as defined in section 63.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall manufacture, package, label or import a natural health product for sale unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds a site licence issued in respect of the activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person conducts the activity in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3.

Subsection.Text: No person who holds a site licence shall manufacture, package, label or import a natural health product for sale

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of any suspension of the licence under section 39 or 40; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after cancellation of the licence under paragraph 41(b).

Section.Text: An application for a site licence shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number, and if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement specifying which one or more of the activities of manufacturing, packaging, labelling or importing the applicant is proposing to conduct;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is proposing to manufacture, package or label a natural health product, the address of each building in which each activity is proposed to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is proposing to import a natural health product, the address of each building in which that natural health product is proposed to be stored;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for each activity specified under paragraph (b), a statement indicating whether or not the applicant is proposing to conduct the activity in respect of a natural health product in sterile dosage form; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the buildings, equipment, practices and procedures used to conduct each activity specified under paragraph (b), a report from a quality assurance person establishing that they comply with the requirements set out in Part 3.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall issue or amend a site licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant submits an application to the Minister that is in accordance with section 28 or subsection 32(2), as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant provides the Minister with all additional information requested under section 37; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not make a false or misleading statement in the application.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister issues a site licence, the Minister shall assign that licence a site licence number.
If the Minister refuses to issue or amend a site licence, the Minister shall send the applicant a notice that sets out the reason for the refusal.
Within 30 days after the day on which the notice is sent, the applicant may make a request that the Minister reconsider the application.
If the applicant makes a request in accordance with subsection (2), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give the applicant an opportunity to be heard in respect of the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reconsider the application after giving the applicant that opportunity.

Subsection.Text: After reconsidering the application, the Minister shall issue or amend the site licence if the requirements of subsection 29(1) are met.
If the Minister again refuses to issue or amend the site licence, the Minister shall send the applicant a final notice that sets out the reason for the refusal.
A licensee shall not conduct any of the following activities unless the site licence is amended accordingly:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct any activity for a which a site licence is required that the licensee is not already authorized to conduct;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensee is authorized to manufacture, package or label a natural health product, conduct that activity in a building in which they are not authorized to do so;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensee is authorized to import a natural health product, store a natural health product in a building in which they are not authorized to do so; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensee is authorized to conduct an activity, but not already authorized to conduct it in respect of a natural health product in sterile dosage form, conduct the activity in respect of a natural health product in that form.

Subsection.Text: An application to amend a site licence shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that specifies each activity referred to in subsection (1) that the licensee is proposing to conduct; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a report from a quality assurance person establishing that the buildings, equipment, practices and procedures used in respect of each activity conducted by the licensee will remain in compliance with the requirements set out in Part 3.

Section.Text: If the licensee makes any of the following changes, the licensee shall notify the Minister of the change within 60 days after the day on which the change is made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the information submitted under paragraph 28(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change that substantially alters any building, equipment, practice or procedure in respect of which a report from a quality assurance person was submitted under paragraph 28(f).

Section.Text: A site licence shall set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the site licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: each activity that the licensee is authorized to conduct and a statement indicating whether the activity is authorized to be conducted in respect of a natural health product in sterile dosage form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensee is authorized to manufacture, package or label a natural health product, the address of each building in which the licensee is authorized to conduct that activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensee is authorized to import a natural health product, the address of each building in which the licensee is authorized to store that natural health product.

Subsection.Text: A site licence expires on the first anniversary of the day on which it was issued unless it is renewed in accordance with section 36.
A site licence that is renewed in accordance with section 36 expires on the day on which the renewal period ends unless the licence is further renewed in accordance with section 36.
The Minister shall renew a site licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee submits a request to renew the licence to the Minister no later than 30 days before the day on which the licence expires;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee provides the Minister with all additional information requested under section 37; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the renewal of the licence is not likely to result in injury to the health of a purchaser or consumer.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister renews a site licence, the Minister shall renew it for a period of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one year, if on the next anniversary of the day on which the licence was issued, the licensee will have held the licence for a period of less than three years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: two years, if on the next anniversary of the day on which the licence was issued, the licensee will have held the licence for a period of at least three years but less than nine years; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: three years, if on the next anniversary of the day on which the licence was issued, the licensee will have held the licence for a period of nine years or more.

Subsection.Text: A site licence renewal becomes effective on the day after the anniversary of the day on which the licence was issued.

Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application under section 28, an application for amendment under subsection 32(2) or a request for renewal under section 36 are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the licence should be issued, amended or renewed, as the case may be, the Minister may request that the applicant provide the Minister with such additional information as is necessary to make the determination.

Subsection.Text: A licensee may, by amendment of the site licence, relinquish any part of the authorization given to the licensee under this Part.
An application to amend the site licence for the purposes of subsection (1) shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a document, signed and dated by the licensee, that sets out the site licence number and that specifies each activity or, by address, each building, in respect of which the authorization is requested to be relinquished; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation, signed and dated by a quality assurance person, stating that after the relinquishment, the buildings, equipment, practices and procedures used in respect of each activity conducted by the licensee will remain in compliance with the requirements set out in Part 3.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall amend the site licence as requested by the licensee in paragraph (2)(a) if the licensee provides the Minister with an application that is in accordance with subsection (2).
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister may suspend a site licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has contravened any provision of the Act or these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has made a false or misleading statement in the application submitted under section 28 or the application for amendment under subsection 32(2).

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 40, the Minister shall not suspend a site licence unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sent the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for the intended suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee has not, within 90 days after the day on which the notice referred to in paragraph (a) is received, provided the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the licence should not be suspended on the grounds that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension did not exist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension has been corrected.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a site licence before giving the licensee an opportunity to be heard if, as a result of any circumstance, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a purchaser or consumer.

If the Minister suspends a site licence under section 39 or 40, the Minister shall send the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for suspension and the day on which the suspension is effective, and the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the licence if, within 90 days after the day on which the suspension is effective, the licensee provides the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the situation giving rise to the suspension did not exist or that it has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the licence if, within 90 days after the day on which the suspension is effective, the licensee has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: If the Minister cancels a licence under paragraph 41(b), the Minister shall send the licensee a notice that sets out the reason for the cancellation and the day on which the cancellation is effective.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell a natural health product unless it is manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed or stored, as the case may be, in accordance with this Part.

A person may sell a natural health product that is manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed or stored, as the case may be, in accordance with requirements that are equivalent to those set out in this Part if the natural health product is imported.

Every natural health product available for sale shall comply with the specifications submitted in respect of that natural health product under paragraph 5(i) and with every change to those specifications made by the product licence holder.
The specifications shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: detailed information respecting the purity of the natural health product, including statements indicating its purity tolerances;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each medicinal ingredient of the natural health product, detailed information respecting its quantity per dosage unit and its identity, including statements indicating its quantity and identity tolerances;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a representation relating to the potency of a medicinal ingredient is to be shown on a label of the natural health product, detailed information respecting the potency of the medicinal ingredient, including statements indicating its potency tolerances; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the methods used for testing or examining the natural health product.

Subsection.Text: The specifications and every change to those specifications shall be approved by a quality assurance person.

Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored in premises that are designed, constructed and maintained in a manner that permits the activity to be conducted under sanitary conditions, and in particular that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: permits the premises to be kept clean and orderly;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permits the effective cleaning of all surfaces in the premises;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permits the natural health product to be stored or processed appropriately;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the contamination of the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prevents the addition of an extraneous substance to the natural health product.

Subsection.Text: Every natural health product shall be stored under conditions that will maintain the quality and safety of the natural health product.

Section.Text: Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored using equipment that is designed, constructed, maintained, operated and arranged in a manner that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: permits the effective cleaning of its surfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permits it to function in accordance with its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prevents it from contaminating the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prevents it from adding an extraneous substance to the natural health product.

Section.Text: Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored by personnel who are qualified by education, training or experience to perform their respective tasks.
Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored in accordance with a sanitation program that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for effectively cleaning the premises in which the activity is conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for effectively cleaning the equipment used in the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for handling any substance used in the activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all requirements, in respect of the health, the hygienic behaviour and the clothing of the personnel who are involved in the activity, that are necessary to ensure that the activity is conducted in sanitary conditions.

Section.Text: Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored in accordance with standard operating procedures that are designed to ensure that the activity is conducted in accordance with the requirements of this Part.

Every manufacturer, packager, labeller, importer and distributor shall establish and maintain a system of control that permits the rapid and complete recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer, packager, labeller, importer and distributor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a quality assurance person who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is responsible for assuring the quality of the natural health product before it is made available for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has training, experience and technical knowledge relating to the activity conducted and the requirements of this Part; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: investigate and record every complaint received in respect of the quality of the natural health product and, if necessary, take corrective action.

Subsection.Text: Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged and labelled using only material that, prior to its use in the activity, has been approved for that use by a quality assurance person.
Every natural health product shall be manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored using methods and procedures that, prior to their implementation, have been approved by a quality assurance person.
Every lot or batch of a natural health product shall be approved by a quality assurance person before it is made available for sale.

Every natural health product that is sold and subsequently returned to its manufacturer, packager, labeller, importer or distributor, as the case may be, shall be approved by a quality assurance person before that natural health product may be made available for resale.

Section.Text: Every manufacturer and every importer shall determine the period of time during which, after being packaged for sale, the natural health product will maintain its purity and physical characteristics and its medicinal ingredients will maintain their quantity per dosage unit and their potency when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is stored under its recommended storage conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it does not have recommended storage conditions, it is stored at room temperature.

Section.Text: Every manufacturer who sells a natural health product shall maintain the following records at the site at which the natural health product is manufactured:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the master production document for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all ingredients contained in each lot or batch of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records of any testing conducted in respect of a lot or batch of raw material used in the manufacture of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records of any testing conducted in respect of a lot or batch of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the specifications for each natural health product that is being manufactured at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: records demonstrating that each lot or batch of the natural health product was manufactured in accordance with the requirements of this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a record of each determination made by the manufacturer in accordance with section 52 and the information that supports that determination;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all natural health products that are being manufactured at the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the sanitation program in use at the site.

Section.Text: Every packager who sells a natural health product shall maintain the following records at the site at which the natural health product is packaged:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: records of any testing conducted in respect of the material used to package the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records demonstrating that each lot or batch of the natural health product was packaged in accordance with the requirements of this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all natural health products that are being packaged at the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the sanitation program in use at the site.

Section.Text: Every labeller who sells a natural health product shall maintain the following records at the site at which the natural health product is labelled:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: records demonstrating that each lot or batch of the natural health product was labelled in accordance with the requirements of this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all natural health products that are being labelled at the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the sanitation program in use at the site.

Section.Text: Every importer who sells a natural health product shall maintain the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the master production document for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all ingredients contained in each lot or batch of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records of any testing conducted in respect of a lot or batch of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the specifications for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of each determination made by the importer in accordance with section 52 and the information that supports that determination;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the sanitation program in use by the importer.

Section.Text: Every distributor shall maintain the following records at the site at which the natural health product is stored:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: records containing sufficient information to enable the recall of every lot or batch of the natural health product that has been made available for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all natural health products that are being stored at the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the sanitation program in use at the site.

Section.Text: Every person required under this Part to maintain a record that relates to a lot or batch of a natural health product shall maintain that record for a period of one year following the expiry date of the natural health product to which that record relates.
Every natural health product that is intended to be sterile shall be manufactured and packaged

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a separate and enclosed area;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under the supervision of a person trained in microbiology; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: using a method scientifically proven to ensure its sterility.

Subsection.Text: Section C.01.064 of the Food and Drug Regulations applies in respect of natural health products except that it shall be read without reference to the words “or parenteral”.
Section C.01.065 of the Food and Drug Regulations applies in respect of natural health products except that it shall be read without reference to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the words “or parenteral”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “or to its common name if there is no proper name”.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that a lot or batch of a natural health product made available for sale may result in injury to the health of a purchaser or consumer, the Minister may require the manufacturer, importer or distributor to provide a sample of that lot or batch.
The sample shall be of sufficient quantity to enable a determination of whether the lot or batch of the natural health product complies with the specifications for that natural health product.
The Minister shall not require a sample of a lot or batch referred to in subsection (1) to be provided if more than one year has elapsed since the expiry date of that natural health product.

Section.Text: Every manufacturer, importer or distributor who commences a recall of a natural health product shall provide the Minister with the following information in respect of that natural health product within three days after the day on which the recall is commenced:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the proper name and the common name of each medicinal ingredient that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each brand name under which it is sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its product number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of each lot or batch recalled;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each manufacturer, importer and distributor of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for commencing the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity manufactured or imported into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity that was distributed in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity remaining in the possession of each manufacturer, importer and distributor of the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any other action that the manufacturer, importer or distributor, as the case may be, is taking in respect of the recall.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: adverse event means any adverse occurrence in the health of a clinical trial subject who is administered a natural health product, that may or may not be caused by the administration of the natural health product, and includes an adverse reaction, a serious adverse reaction and a serious unexpected adverse reaction. (incident thérapeutique)

clinical trial means an investigation in respect of a natural health product that involves human subjects and that is intended to discover or verify its clinical, pharmacological or pharmacodynamic effects, to identify any adverse events that are related to its use, to study its absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion, or to ascertain its safety or efficacy. (essai clinique)

good clinical practices means generally accepted clinical practices that are designed to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of clinical trial subjects and other persons, and the good clinical practices referred to in section 74. (bonnes pratiques cliniques)
import means to import a natural health product into Canada for the purpose of sale in a clinical trial. (importer)
investigator’s brochure means a document containing the preclinical and clinical information in respect of the natural health product that is described in paragraph 66(e). (brochure du chercheur)
protocol means a document that describes the objectives, design, methodology, statistical considerations and organization of a clinical trial. (protocole)

qualified investigator means the person responsible to the sponsor for the conduct of the clinical trial at a clinical trial site, who is entitled to provide health care under the laws of the province where the clinical trial site is located and who is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a clinical trial respecting a natural health product to be used for dental purposes only, a physician or dentist and a member in good standing of a professional medical or dental association; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, a physician and a member in good standing of a professional medical association. (chercheur qualifié)

Definition.Text: research ethics board means a body that is not affiliated with the sponsor, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the principal mandate of which is to approve the initiation of, and conduct periodic reviews of, biomedical research involving human subjects in order to ensure the protection of their rights, safety and well-being; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that has at least five members, that has a majority of members who are Canadian citizens or permanent residents under the Immigration Act, that is composed of both men and women and that includes at least

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two members whose primary experience and expertise are in a scientific discipline, who have broad experience in the methods and areas of research to be approved and one of whom is from a medical discipline or, if the clinical trial is in respect of a natural health product to be used for dental purposes only, is from a medical or dental discipline,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in complementary or alternative health care,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in ethics,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in Canadian laws relevant to the research to be approved,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: one member whose primary experience and expertise are in a non-scientific discipline, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: one member who is from the community or is a representative of an organization interested in the areas of research to be approved and who is not affiliated with the sponsor or the site where the clinical trial is to be conducted. (comité d’éthique de la recherche)

Definition.Text: sponsor means an individual, corporate body, institution or organization that conducts a clinical trial. (promoteur)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), this Part applies to the sale or importation of natural health products to be used for the purposes of clinical trials involving human subjects.

Except for paragraph 65(1)(a), subsection 65(2), section 68, paragraphs 74(a) to (i), subsections 75(1) and 76(1) and (2), paragraphs 76(3)(a) to (d) and (f) to (h), subsection 76(4) and sections 77 and 80 to 83, this Part does not apply to the sale or importation of a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial authorized under section 68.
Despite section 4 and subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is authorized under this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person complies with this Part and section C.01.064 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the natural health product is to be imported, the person has a representative in Canada who is responsible for the sale of the natural health product.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of any suspension of the authorization under section 80 or 81; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after cancellation of the authorization under paragraph 82(b).

Section.Text: An application by a sponsor for authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial shall be submitted to the Minister and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the protocol for the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the statement, as it will be set out in each informed consent form, that states the risks and anticipated benefits arising to the health of clinical trial subjects as a result of their participation in the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a clinical trial attestation, signed and dated by the sponsor, containing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of the protocol and the clinical trial number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name or the code for the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each medicinal ingredient of the natural health product

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the proper name and common name of the ingredient, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the quantity of the ingredient per dosage unit of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a qualitative list of the non-medicinal ingredients of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the dosage form of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the sponsor,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the natural health product is to be imported, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the sponsor’s representative in Canada who is responsible for the sale of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of each clinical trial site,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the qualified investigator,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the research ethics board that approved the protocol referred to in paragraph (a) and approved an informed consent form containing the statement referred to in paragraph (b),

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of any research ethics board that has previously refused to approve the protocol referred to in paragraph (a), its reasons for doing so and the date on which the refusal was given, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that the clinical trial will be conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and these Regulations, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: that all information contained in, or referenced by, the application is complete and accurate and is not false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation, signed and dated by the research ethics board for each clinical trial site, that it has reviewed and approved the protocol referred to in paragraph (a) and an informed consent form containing the statement referred to in paragraph (b) and that the board carries out its functions in a manner consistent with good clinical practices;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an investigator’s brochure that contains the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the physical, chemical and, if any, the pharmaceutical properties of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the chemistry and manufacturing information of each synthetically manufactured medicinal ingredient of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacological properties of the natural health product, if any, including its metabolites in all animal species tested,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the pharmacokinetics of the natural health product and the natural health product metabolism, if any, including the biological transformation of the natural health product in all animal species tested,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the toxicological effects, if any, in any animal species tested under a single dose study, a repeated dose study or a special study in respect of the natural health product,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of carcinogenicity studies in any animal species tested in respect of the natural health product, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of clinical pharmacokinetic studies of the natural health product, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information regarding natural health product safety, pharmacodynamics, efficacy and dose responses of the natural health product that were obtained from previous clinical trials in humans, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the known contra-indications for and the precautions to be taken in respect of the natural health product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended treatment in the event of an overdose of the natural health product, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date for the commencement of the clinical trial at each clinical trial site.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall authorize a sponsor to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor submits an application to the Minister that is in accordance with section 66;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor provides the Minister with all additional information or samples requested under section 73; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe, based on an assessment of the application, an assessment of any samples or information provided under section 73 or a review of any other information that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial will not endanger the health of a clinical trial subject or other person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the clinical trial is not contrary to the best interests of the clinical trial subjects, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will be achieved.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall authorize the sponsor to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial by sending the sponsor a notice of the authorization.

Section.Text: A sponsor is authorized to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial if the clinical trial is in respect of a recommended use or purpose for which that natural health product is issued a product licence.

The sponsor shall notify the Minister of the date of the sale or importation of a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial at a clinical trial site at least 15 days before the date of that sale or importation.

If the sale or importation of a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial is authorized under this Part, the sponsor may make one or more of the following changes if the sponsor provides the Minister with notification of the change within 15 days after the day on which the change is made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the information referred to in subparagraph 66(e)(ii) that does not affect the quality or safety of the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the protocol that does not alter the risk to the health of a clinical trial subject, other than a change for which an amendment is required by section 71.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the sale or importation of a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial is authorized under this Part, the sponsor may not make any of the following amendments unless the authorization is amended accordingly:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the protocol that affects the selection, monitoring or dismissal of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the protocol that affects the evaluation of the clinical efficacy of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the protocol that alters the risk to the health of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the protocol that affects the safety evaluation of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the protocol that extends the duration of the clinical trial; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment to the information referred to in subparagraph 66(e)(ii) that may affect the safety or quality of that natural health product.

Subsection.Text: If the sponsor is required to immediately make one or more of the amendments referred to in subsection (1) because the clinical trial or the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person, the sponsor may immediately make the amendment and shall provide the Minister with the information referred to in subsection (3) within 15 days after the day on which the amendment is made.

An application by the sponsor to amend the authorization for the sale or importation of a natural health product under this Part shall be submitted to the Minister and, in addition to a reference to the application submitted under section 66, shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if as a result of the amendment it is necessary to amend the statement referred to in paragraph 66(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the amended statement that indicates the new information, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the research ethics board that approved the amended statement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (e),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the amended protocol that indicates the amendment,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the protocol submitted under paragraph 66(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the rationale for the amendment,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the research ethics board that approved the amended protocol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of any research ethics board that has previously refused to approve any amendment to the protocol, its reasons for doing so and the date on which the refusal was given;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (1)(e), a copy of the amended investigator’s brochure or an addendum to the investigator’s brochure that indicates the new information, including supporting toxicological studies and clinical trial safety data, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (1)(f), a copy of the amended chemistry and manufacturing information that indicates the amendment, and the rationale for that amendment.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall amend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor submits an application for amendment to the Minister that is in accordance with subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor provides the Minister with all additional information or samples requested under section 73; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe, based on an assessment of the application for amendment, an assessment of any samples or information submitted under section 73 or a review of any other information that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial will not endanger the health of a clinical trial subject or other person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the clinical trial is not contrary to the best interests of the clinical trial subjects, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will be achieved.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall amend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial by sending the sponsor a notice of the amendment.

Section.Text: If the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial is amended in accordance with subsection 71(5), the sponsor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before commencing to sell or import the natural health product in accordance with the amended authorization

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cease to sell or import the natural health product in accordance with the existing authorization, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
