Subparagraph.Text: maintain records concerning the information referred to in subparagraph 66(c)(ix), if any of that information has changed since it was submitted, and the information referred to in paragraph 66(f); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct the clinical trial in accordance with the amended authorization.

Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application under section 66 or an application for amendment under subsection 71(3) are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the sale or importation of the natural health product should be authorized or whether the authorization should be amended, as the case may be, the Minister may request that the sponsor provide the Minister with samples of the natural health product or additional information relevant to the natural health product or the clinical trial that are necessary to make the determination.
Every sponsor shall ensure that a clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is scientifically sound and clearly described in a protocol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is conducted, and the natural health product is used, in accordance with the protocol and this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: systems and procedures that assure the quality of every aspect of the clinical trial are implemented;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the approval of a research ethics board is obtained before the clinical trial begins at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, there is no more than one qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, medical care and medical decisions, in respect of the clinical trial, are under the supervision of the qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each individual involved in the conduct of the clinical trial is qualified by education, training and experience to perform his or her respective tasks;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: written informed consent, given in accordance with the applicable laws governing consent, is obtained from every person before that person participates in the clinical trial but only after that person has been informed of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the risks and anticipated benefits to his or her health arising from participation in the clinical trial, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all other aspects of the clinical trial that are necessary for that person to make the decision to participate in the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements respecting information and records set out in section 76 are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is manufactured and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 except for section 61.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall ensure that the natural health product bears a label that sets out the following information in both official languages:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating that the natural health product is an investigational natural health product to be used only by a qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or code of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended storage conditions for the natural health product, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the sponsor; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the protocol code or identification.

Subsection.Text: Sections 86 to 94 do not apply to a natural health product used for the purposes of a clinical trial.
The sponsor shall record, handle and store all information in respect of a clinical trial in a way that allows its complete and accurate reporting as well as its interpretation and verification.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records to demonstrate that the clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and these Regulations.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records in respect of the use of a natural health product in a clinical trial, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of all versions of the investigator’s brochure for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting each change made to the investigator’s brochure, including the rationale for each change and documentation that supports each change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting all adverse events in respect of the natural health product that have occurred inside or outside Canada, including information that specifies the dosage form and the use and purpose of the natural health product at the time of the adverse event;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the enrolment of clinical trial subjects, including information sufficient to enable all clinical trial subjects to be identified and contacted in the event that the sale of the natural health product may endanger the health of the clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the shipment, receipt, disposition, return and destruction of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an undertaking from the qualified investigator that is signed and dated by the qualified investigator prior to the commencement of his or her responsibilities in respect of the clinical trial, that states that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will conduct the clinical trial in accordance with good clinical practices, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will immediately, on discontinuance of the clinical trial by the sponsor, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, notify both the clinical trial subjects and the research ethics board of the discontinuance, provide them with the reasons for the discontinuance and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, a copy of the protocol, informed consent form and any amendment to the protocol or informed consent form that have been approved by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an attestation, signed and dated by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site, stating that it has reviewed and approved the protocol and informed consent form and that the board carries out its functions in a manner consistent with good clinical practices.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall maintain all records referred to in this Part for a period of 15 years.

The Minister shall require a sponsor to provide, within two days after the day on which the request is received, information concerning the natural health product or the clinical trial, or samples of the natural health product, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is contrary to the best interests of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator is not respecting the undertaking referred to in paragraph 76(3)(f); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information submitted or provided in respect of the natural health product or the clinical trial is false or misleading.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may require the sponsor to provide, within seven days after the day on which the request is received, any information or records referred to in section 76, or samples of the natural health product, in order to assess the safety of the natural health product or the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons.

During the course of a clinical trial, the sponsor shall notify the Minister of any serious adverse reaction and any serious unexpected adverse reaction to the natural health product that has occurred inside Canada as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is neither fatal nor life threatening, within 15 days after the day on which the sponsor becomes aware of the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is fatal or life threatening, within seven days after the day on which the sponsor becomes aware of the information.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall, within eight days after the day on which the Minister is notified under paragraph (1)(b), provide the Minister with a complete report in respect of that information that includes an assessment of the importance and implication of any findings made.
If the sponsor discontinues a clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister of the discontinuance within 15 days after the day of the discontinuance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with the reason for the discontinuance and its impact on the proposed or ongoing clinical trials in respect of the natural health product conducted in Canada by the sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as possible, notify all qualified investigators of the discontinuance and of the reasons for the discontinuance, and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each discontinued clinical trial site, stop the sale or importation of the natural health product as of the day of the discontinuance and take all reasonable measures to ensure the recovery of all unused quantities of the natural health product that have been sold.

Subsection.Text: If the sponsor discontinues a clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor may resume selling or importing the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial in its entirety or at the clinical trial site if, in respect of each clinical trial site where the sale or importation is to be resumed, the sponsor submits to the Minister the information referred to in subparagraphs 66(c)(ix) to (xi) and paragraphs 66(d) and (f).

Subject to subsection (2), the Minister may suspend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has contravened these Regulations or any provisions of the Act relating to the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information submitted or provided in respect of the natural health product or clinical trial is false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to comply with good clinical practices; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provide information or samples of the natural health product as required under section 73 or 77, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notify the Minister or provide a report under section 78.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 81, the Minister shall not suspend the authorization unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sent the sponsor a notice that indicates whether the authorization is intended to be suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site and the reason for the intended suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has not, within 30 days after the day on which the notice referred to in paragraph (a) is received, provided the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the authorization should not be suspended on the grounds that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension did not exist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension has been corrected.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, before giving the sponsor an opportunity to be heard if, as a result of any circumstance, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a clinical trial subject or other person.

If the Minister suspends the authorization under section 80 or 81, the Minister shall send the sponsor a notice that sets out the reason for the suspension, the day on which the suspension is effective and indicating whether the authorization is suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, and the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the day on which the suspension is effective the sponsor provides the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the situation giving rise to the suspension did not exist or that it has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the day on which the suspension is effective the sponsor has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: If the Minister cancels the authorization under paragraph 82(b), the Minister shall send the sponsor a notice that sets out the reason for the cancellation, the day on which the cancellation is effective and indicating whether the authorization is cancelled in its entirety or at a clinical trial site.
Any signature that is required by these Regulations to be shown on a record or document may be an electronic reproduction of the required signature.
Any record that is required to be maintained by these Regulations may be maintained in any electronic format from which a printed copy of the record can be produced.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a natural health product unless it is labelled and packaged in accordance with these Regulations.
Despite subsection (1), a person may sell a natural health product that is not labelled and packaged in accordance with these Regulations if the sale is to a manufacturer or distributor.
Subject to subsection (2), when required by these Regulations to be shown on a label, the following information respecting a natural health product shall be in both English and French:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f) of the definition recommended conditions of use in subsection 1(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the common name and proper name of each medicinal ingredient and each non-medicinal ingredient that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the source material of a medicinal ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its storage conditions.

Subsection.Text: The common name or proper name of a medicinal ingredient or non-medicinal ingredient shall be shown in any other language if the name does not have an English or French equivalent.

Section.Text: The statements, information and declarations required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: clearly and prominently displayed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: readily discernible to the purchaser or consumer of the natural health product under the customary conditions of purchase and use.

Section.Text: If a natural health product has only one label, that label shall show all the statements, information and declarations required by these Regulations to be shown on both the inner and outer labels.
Every lot number required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be preceded by one of the following designations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot number”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot No.”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot”; or

Section.Text: Every product number required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a homeopathic medicine, be preceded by the designation “DIN-HM”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, be preceded by the designation “NPN”.

Section.Text: No reference, direct or indirect, to the Act, the Food and Drug Regulations or to these Regulations shall be made on any label of or in any advertisement for a natural health product unless the reference is specifically required by law.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 94, the inner and outer labels shall show the following information in respect of a natural health product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its product number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is sterile, the words “sterile” and “stérile”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the net amount in the immediate container in terms of weight, measure or number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on any panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the product licence holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is imported, the name and address of the importer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the common name of each medicinal ingredient that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of each medicinal ingredient it contains, but only if the proper name is not the chemical name,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a list by proper name, or by common name if the proper name is the chemical name, that sets out the quantity of each medicinal ingredient per dosage unit and, if any, the authorized potency of that medicinal ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended use or purpose,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended route of administration,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended dose,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: its risk information including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with its use,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended storage conditions, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: its lot number,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: its expiry date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the source material of each medicinal ingredient that it contains.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements set out in subsection (1), the outer label shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a qualitative list by common name, preceded by the words “non-medicinal ingredients”, of all non-medicinal ingredients of the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the natural health product contains mercury or any of its salts or derivatives as a non-medicinal ingredient, a statement that sets out the quantity of mercury contained in the natural health product.

Subsection.Text: The natural health product shall be labelled as follows if the immediate container is not large enough to accommodate an inner label that complies with the requirements of section 93:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label shall show the following in respect of the natural health product, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a qualitative list by proper name, or by common name if the proper name is the chemical name, that in descending order of quantity per dosage unit, sets out all medicinal ingredients that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended dose,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its lot number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its expiry date,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: its product number,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is sterile, the words “sterile” and “stérile”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the net amount in the immediate container in terms of weight, measure or number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended use or purpose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: if it does not have an outer label, a statement that refers the purchaser or consumer to the leaflet that is required in accordance with subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the outer label, if any, shall be labelled as required under section 93.

Subsection.Text: If the natural health product does not have an outer label, the statements, information and declarations required to be shown on the outer label under section 93 shall be shown in a leaflet that is affixed or attached to the immediate container.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell or import a natural health product that is packaged unless the natural health product is contained in a security package.
Subsection (1) does not apply to lozenges.
Subject to subsection (4), a statement or illustration that draws attention to the security feature of the security package referred to in subsection (1) shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the inner label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the security feature is a part of the outer package, on the outer label.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply if the security feature of a security package is self-evident and is an integral part of the immediate container.

Section.Text: Sections A.01.061 to A.01.063 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.

Heading.TitleText: Cautionary Statements and Child Resistant Packages

Section.Text: Subsections C.01.001(2) to (4) and C.01.028(1), paragraphs C.01.028(2)(b) and (c), section C.01.029, subsection C.01.031(1), paragraphs C.01.031.2(1)(a) and (c) to (g), subsection C.01.031.2(2), and paragraphs C.01.031.2(3)(a) and (c) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Section C.01.012 of the Food and Drug Regulations applies in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.022 to A.01.026 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.040 to A.01.044 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Section A.01.045 of the Food and Drug Regulations and Appendix III to those Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.050 and A.01.051 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Subsection C.01.015(1) and paragraphs C.01.015(2)(d) to (f) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of Natural Health Product for Emergency Treatment

Section.Text: Section C.08.010 and subsections C.08.011(1) and (3) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products except that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a reference in those sections to “new drug” shall be read as a reference to “natural health product”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reference in subsection C.08.011(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations to “section C.08.002” shall be read as a reference to “subsection 4(1) of the Natural Health Products Regulations”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)

Paragraph.Text: the expression “the Minister has not cancelled the assignment of a drug identification number for the new drug under paragraph C.01.014.6(2)(b) or (c) or subsection C.01.014.6(3)” in paragraph C.08.010(2)(c) of the Food and Drug Regulations is to be read as “the Minister has not, in respect of a natural health product, suspended the product licence under subsection 18(1) or section 19 of the Natural Health Products Regulations or cancelled the product licence under paragraph 20(b) of those Regulations”.

Section.Text: A natural health product is exempt from subsection 3(1) of the Act with respect to its advertisement to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

A natural health product is exempt from subsection 3(2) of the Act with respect to its sale by a person where the natural health product is represented by label or is advertised by that person to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Distribution of Natural Health Products as Samples

Subsection.Text: If a practitioner or pharmacist has signed an order specifying the proper name or common name, the brand name and the quantity of a natural health product, the person who receives the order may distribute or cause to be distributed the natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to that practitioner or pharmacist if the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.
An order referred to in subsection (1) may provide that the order be repeated at specified intervals during any period that does not exceed six months.

Despite subsection (1), a person may distribute or cause to be distributed a natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to a practitioner or pharmacist without a signed order if that natural health product has a localized effect and is for administration either in the oral cavity or on the skin, or is a throat lozenge, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is part of a class of natural health products that is set out in column 1 of List A and contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the natural health product is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists of a day, month and year, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, practitioner and pharmacist have the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: A person who, under subsection 103.4(1), receives an order for and distributes or causes to be distributed a natural health product as a sample shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain records showing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and description of each person to whom the natural health product was distributed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, quantity and dosage form of the natural health product distributed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the natural health product was distributed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep those records and all orders received for natural health products under subsection 103.4(1) for a period of not less than two years from the date on which the distribution referred to in the records was made.

Section.Text: A person may distribute or cause to be distributed a natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to any consumer that is 18 years of age or older if that natural health product has a localized effect and is for administration either in the oral cavity or on the skin, or is a throat lozenge, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is part of a class of natural health products that is set out in column 1 of List A and contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the natural health product is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists of a day, month and year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 110, a person may, without complying with these Regulations, sell a drug to which these Regulations apply that is assigned a drug identification number in accordance with section C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a product licence in respect of the drug is disposed of or withdrawn, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: December 31, 2009.

Subsection.Text: A person who sells a drug under subsection (1) shall conduct that sale in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: An application for a product licence that is made in respect of a drug referred to in subsection 108(1) on or before December 31, 2009 is not required to contain the information referred to in paragraph 5(g).

A sale or importation of a drug to which these Regulations apply that, before January 1, 2004, is authorized for the purposes of a clinical trial under Division 5 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations shall continue to be regulated under that Division.

Until December 31, 2009, a person may sell a lot or batch of a drug referred to in section 108 that is not labelled or packaged in accordance with the requirements of Part 5 if the lot or batch is packaged in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

If during the period beginning on January 1, 2004 and ending on December 31, 2005, the information referred to in section 22 is not available to the licensee prior to commencing the sale of the natural health product or within 30 days after the day on which the license is issued in respect of the natural health product, as the case may be, the licensee shall provide the information to the Minister immediately after it is available to the licensee.

Subsection.Text: A person who, before January 1, 2004, manufactures, packages, labels or imports for sale a drug to which these Regulations apply may continue to conduct the activity in respect of that drug without complying with the requirements of Parts 2 and 3, until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which that person’s application for a site licence to conduct that activity in respect of the drug is disposed of or withdrawn, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: December 31, 2005.

Subsection.Text: A person who conducts an activity under subsection (1) shall conduct that activity in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

A person who, before January 1, 2004, distributes a drug to which these Regulations apply may continue to conduct the activity in respect of that drug without complying with the requirements of Part 3 until December 31, 2005.
A person who conducts an activity under subsection (1) shall conduct that activity in accordance with the requirements of Division 2 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: A person may sell a lot or batch of a drug referred to in section 108 that is not manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed or stored, as the case may be, in accordance with the requirements of Part 3 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the lot or batch is manufactured, packaged and labelled before January 1, 2006; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any manufacturing, packaging, labelling, importation, distribution or storage of the lot or batch that is not conducted in accordance with the requirements of Part 3 is conducted in accordance with the requirements of Division 2 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations.
